00086 /* Different buffer allocation types. */
00087 #define  OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_1    1  /* Allocated using malloc etc */
00088 #define  OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_2    2  /* Of type skb etc.. */
00089 #define  OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_3    3  /* Allocated from the buffer pool */
00090 #define  OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_4    4  /* Allocated using virtual memory calls */

00119 {                                           \

00122     set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);        \

00127 /** Host: The different levels of debugging print messages available.
00128   * Enable debugging by compiling with CAVIUM_DEBUG set to one of these
00129   * values.
00130   */
00131 typedef enum {
00132   PRINT_ERROR = 0,
00133   PRINT_MSG   = 0,
00134   PRINT_REGS  = 1,
00135   PRINT_DEBUG = 2,
00136   PRINT_FLOW  = 3,
00137   PRINT_ALL   = 4,
00138 } OCTEON_DEBUG_LEVEL;

00145 {     if(level <= octeon_debug_level)   printk( format, ## __VA_ARGS__);  }

00147 #define  cavium_print(level, format, ...)       do { }while(0);

00194 
00195 
00196 #define INIT_CVM_KTHREAD(pcvmthread)                     \
00197     (memset((pcvmthread), 0, sizeof(cvm_kthread_t)))
00198 
00199 #define SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN(pcvmthread, fn)               \
00200     ((pcvmthread)->fn = fn)
00201 
00202 #define SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN_ARG(pcvmthread, fn_arg)       \
00203     ((pcvmthread)->fn_arg = fn_arg)
00204 
00205 #define SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN_STRING(pcvmthread, fn_string) \
00206     do {                                                 \
00207         if(fn_string) {                                  \
00208             strcpy((pcvmthread)->fn_string,fn_string);   \
00209         }                                                \
00210     } while(0)
00211 
00212 
00213 #define SET_CVM_KTHREAD_EXEC_ON_CREATE(pcvmthread)       \
00214     ((pcvmthread)->exec_on_create = 1)
00215 
00216 static inline int
00217 cavium_kthread_setup(cvm_kthread_t   *t,
00218                      int            (*fn)(void *),
00219                      void            *fn_arg,
00220                      char            *fn_string,
00221                      int              exec_flag)
00222 {
00223     SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN(t, fn);
00224     SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN_ARG(t, fn_arg);
00225     SET_CVM_KTHREAD_FN_STRING(t, fn_string);
00226     t->exec_on_create = exec_flag;
00227 
00228     return 0;
00229 }
00230 
00231 
00232 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,18)
00233 
00234 #define CVM_KTHREAD_EXISTS(pcvmthread)   ((pcvmthread)->id >= 0)
00235 
00236 static inline int
00237 cavium_kthread_create(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00238 {
00239     t->id = kernel_thread(t->fn, t->fn_arg, CLONE_FS|CLONE_FILES|CLONE_SIGHAND);
00240     return (t->id < 0);
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline int
00244 cavium_kthread_signalled(void)
00245 {
00246     return signal_pending(current);
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline void
00250 cavium_kthread_destroy(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00251 {
00252     if(t->id >= 0) {
00253         kill_proc(t->id, SIGTERM, 1);
00254     }
00255     t->id = -1;
00256 }
00257 
00258 static inline void
00259 cavium_kthread_set_cpu_affinity(cvm_kthread_t  *t, int cpu)
00260 {
00261     cavium_error("%s: Nothing implemented\n", __CVM_FUNCTION__);
00262 }
00263 
00264 static inline void
00265 cavium_kthread_run(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00266 {
00267     cavium_error("%s: Nothing implemented\n", __CVM_FUNCTION__);
00268 }
00269 
00270 #else
00271 
00272 #define CVM_KTHREAD_EXISTS(pcvmthread)   ((pcvmthread)->id)
00273 
00274 static inline int
00275 cavium_kthread_create(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00276 {
00277 
00278     t->id = kthread_create(t->fn, t->fn_arg, t->fn_string);
00279     if (t->id == NULL)
00280         return 1;
00281 
00282     if(t->exec_on_create)
00283         wake_up_process(t->id);
00284     
00285     return 0;
00286 }
00287 
00288 static inline int
00289 cavium_kthread_signalled(void)
00290 {
00291     return kthread_should_stop();
00292 }
00293 
00294 static inline void
00295 cavium_kthread_destroy(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00296 {
00297     if(t->id) {
00298         kthread_stop(t->id);
00299     }
00300     t->id = NULL;
00301 }
00302 
00303 static inline void
00304 cavium_kthread_set_cpu_affinity(cvm_kthread_t  *t, int cpu)
00305 {
00306     if(t->id) {
00307         kthread_bind(t->id, cpu);
00308     }
00309 }
00310 
00311 static inline void
00312 cavium_kthread_run(cvm_kthread_t  *t)
00313 {
00314     if(t->id) {
00315         wake_up_process(t->id);
00316     }
00317 }

00344 
00345 static inline int
00346 cavium_atomic_check_and_sub(int val, cavium_atomic_t *ptr, char *file, int line)
00347 {
00348     if( (cavium_atomic_read((ptr)) - val) < 0) {
00349         cavium_error("OCTEON: %s:%d Underflow in atomic value (%d) (attempt to subtract %d)\n", file, line, cavium_atomic_read((ptr)), val);
00350         return 1;
00351     }
00352     atomic_sub((val),(ptr));
00353     return 0;
00354 }
00355 
00356 
00357 static inline int
00358 cavium_atomic_check_and_dec(cavium_atomic_t *ptr, char *file, int line)
00359 {
00360     if( (cavium_atomic_read((ptr)) - 1) < 0) {
00361         cavium_error("OCTEON: %s:%d Underflow in atomic value (%d)\n",
00362                      file, line, cavium_atomic_read((ptr)));
00363         return 1;
00364     }
00365     atomic_dec((ptr));
00366     return 0;
00367 }
00368 
00369 
00370 static inline int
00371 cavium_atomic_check_and_inc(cavium_atomic_t *ptr, int check_val, char *file, int line)
00372 {
00373     if( (cavium_atomic_read((ptr)) + 1) > check_val) {
00374         cavium_error("OCTEON: %s:%d Overflow in atomic value (%d) (max: %d)\n",
00375                       file, line, cavium_atomic_read((ptr)), check_val);
00376         return 1;
00377     }
00378     atomic_inc((ptr));
00379     return 0;
00380 }
00381 
00382 
00383 static inline int
00384 cavium_atomic_check_and_add(int val, cavium_atomic_t *ptr, int check_val, char *file, int line)
00385 {
00386     if( (cavium_atomic_read((ptr)) + val) > check_val) {
00387         cavium_error("OCTEON: %s:%d Overflow in atomic value (%d) (attempt to add %d, max: %d)\n", file, line, cavium_atomic_read((ptr)), val, check_val);
00388         return 1;
00389     }
00390     atomic_add((val), (ptr));
00391     return 0;
00392 }

00399 static inline unsigned long
00400 cavium_div64(unsigned long long  x, unsigned long long y, unsigned long *r)
00401 {
00402     unsigned long mod;
00403 
00404     /* do_div puts result of x/y in x and remainder is returned. */
00405     mod = do_div(x, y);
00406     *r  = x;
00407     return mod;
00408 }

00413 
00414 static inline void
00415 cavium_sleep_cond(cavium_wait_channel  *wait_queue, int *condition)
00416 {
00417     cavium_wait_entry      we;
00418 
00419     cavium_init_wait_entry(&we, current);
00420     cavium_add_to_waitq(wait_queue, &we);
00421     set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00422     while(!(*condition))
00423         schedule();
00424     set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING); 
00425     cavium_remove_from_waitq(wait_queue, &we);
00426 }
00427 
00428 
00429 
00430 static inline void
00431 cavium_sleep_atomic_cond(cavium_wait_channel  *waitq, cavium_atomic_t *pcond)
00432 {
00433     cavium_wait_entry      we;
00434 
00435     cavium_init_wait_entry(&we, current);
00436     cavium_add_to_waitq(waitq, &we);
00437     set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00438     while(!cavium_atomic_read(pcond))
00439         schedule();
00440     set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING); 
00441     cavium_remove_from_waitq(waitq, &we);
00442 }
00443 
00444 
00445 
00446 /* Gives up the CPU for a timeout period.
00447    Check that the condition is not true before we go to sleep for a
00448    timeout period.  */
00449 static inline  void 
00450 cavium_sleep_timeout_cond(cavium_wait_channel  *wait_queue, int  *condition, int timeout)
00451 {
00452     cavium_wait_entry      we;
00453 
00454     cavium_init_wait_entry(&we, current);
00455     cavium_add_to_waitq(wait_queue, &we);
00456     set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00457     if(!(*condition))
00458         schedule_timeout(timeout);
00459     set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00460     cavium_remove_from_waitq(wait_queue, &we);
00461 }

00471 #if !defined(readq)
00472 static inline uint64_t
00473 OCTEON_READ64(void *addr)
00474 {
00475     uint64_t   val64;
00476     val64 = readl(addr + 4);
00477     val64 = (val64 << 32) | readl(addr);
00478     return val64;
00479 }
00480 #endif
00481 
00482 
00483 
00484 #if !defined(writeq)
00485 static inline void
00486 OCTEON_WRITE64(void *addr, uint64_t val)
00487 {
00488     writel((uint32_t)(val & 0xffffffff), addr);
00489     writel((val >> 32), ((uint8_t *)addr + 4));
00490 }
00491 #endif

00510 octeon_pci_free_consistent(cavium_pci_device_t *pci_dev, uint32_t  size,

00515 
00516 #define USE_PCIMAP_CALLS
00517 
00518 static inline unsigned long
00519 octeon_pci_map_single(cavium_pci_device_t *pci_dev, void *virt_addr,
00520                       uint32_t  size, int direction)
00521 {
00522     unsigned long  physaddr;
00523 #if defined(USE_PCIMAP_CALLS)
00524     physaddr = pci_map_single(pci_dev, virt_addr, size, direction);
00525 #else
00526     physaddr = virt_to_phys(virt_addr);
00527 #endif
00528 //  printk("physaddr: %lx\n", physaddr);
00529     return physaddr;
00530 }
00531 
00532 static inline void 
00533 octeon_pci_unmap_single(cavium_pci_device_t  *pci_dev, unsigned long dma_addr,
00534                         uint32_t  size, int direction)
00535 {
00536 #if defined(USE_PCIMAP_CALLS)
00537     pci_unmap_single(pci_dev, (dma_addr_t)dma_addr, size, direction);
00538 #endif
00539 }

00560 
00561 
00562 static inline void *
00563 get_new_recv_buffer(uint32_t size)
00564 {
00565 #if 1
00566 #define SKB_ADJUST_MASK  0x3F
00567 #define SKB_ADJUST       (SKB_ADJUST_MASK + 1)
00568 
00569     struct sk_buff *skb = dev_alloc_skb(size + SKB_ADJUST);
00570     if( (unsigned long)skb->data & SKB_ADJUST_MASK) {
00571         uint32_t  r = SKB_ADJUST - ((unsigned long)skb->data & SKB_ADJUST_MASK);
00572         skb_reserve(skb, r);
00573     }
00574     /*if( (unsigned long)skb->data & SKB_ADJUST_MASK) {
00575         printk("skb->data @ %p\n", skb->data);
00576     }*/
00577 #else
00578     struct sk_buff *skb = dev_alloc_skb(size + 2);
00579     if(skb)
00580         skb_reserve(skb, 2);
00581 #endif
00582 
00583     return ((void *)skb);
00584 }
00585 
00586 
00587 
00588 #define   get_recv_buffer_data(ptr)      (((struct sk_buff *)(ptr))->data)
00589 #define   get_recv_buffer_cb(ptr)        (((struct sk_buff *)(ptr))->cb)
00590 
00591 
00592 
00593 /** Copy contents of one Output Queue buffer to another.
00594  *  @param d_buf    - Output Queue buffer to copy to.
00595  *  @param s_buf    - Output queue buffer to copy from.
00596  *  @param d_offset - Offset in data pointer of dest buffer to start copy.
00597  *  @param length   - NUmber of bytes to copy.
00598  *  
00599  *  Copies length bytes from s_buf's data buffer at address d_offset bytes from
00600  *  d_buf's data buffer. The control data from s_buf is copied as it is to d_buf.
00601  */
00602 static inline void 
00603 copy_recv_buffer(void *d_buf, void *s_buf, uint32_t d_offset, uint32_t length)
00604 {
00605     struct sk_buff  *d_skb = (struct sk_buff *)d_buf;
00606     struct sk_buff  *s_skb = (struct sk_buff *)s_buf;
00607 
00608     memcpy(d_skb->data + d_offset, s_skb->data, length);
00609 }
00610 
00611 
00612 
00613 
00614 /** Call this routine to free the recv_info packet buffers.
00615   * Depending on the buffer type the packet buffers need to be
00616   * freed using different calls.
00617   * @param buf      - the buffer to be freed.
00618   * @param buf_type - the buffer type for the recv_pkt.
00619   */
00620 static __inline void
00621 cavium_free_recv_pkt_buf(void *buf, uint32_t  buf_type)
00622 {
00623     if(buf_type == OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_1)  {
00624         cavium_free_dma(buf);
00625     }  else  {
00626         if(buf_type == OCT_BUFFER_TYPE_2)
00627             free_recv_buffer(buf);
00628         else
00629             cavium_error("OCTEON: Unknown recv buf type. Buffer not freed\n");
00630     }
00631 }

00637 
00638 /** Prints contents of a memory location when an error occurs.
00639   * The message is always printed and is not dependent on the debug level.
00640   * @param data - the address where data is located.
00641   * @param size - size of data to be printed at "data".
00642   */
00643 static inline void
00644 cavium_error_print(uint8_t *data, uint32_t  size)
00645 {
00646     uint32_t  i;
00647 
00648     printk("Printing %d bytes @ 0x%p\n", size, data);
00649     for(i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00650         if(!(i & 0x7))
00651             printk("\n");
00652         printk(" %02x", data[i]);
00653     }
00654     printk("\n");
00655 }
00656 
00657 
00658 
00659 
00660 static inline void
00661 cavium_error_print_8B_data(uint64_t *data, uint32_t  size)
00662 {
00663     uint32_t  i, blocks;
00664 
00665     blocks = (size >> 3) + ((size & 0x07)?1:0);
00666     printk("Printing %d 8B blocks @ 0x%p\n", blocks, data);
00667     for(i = 0; i < blocks; i++)
00668         printk(" %016llx\n", CVM_CAST64(data[i]));
00669     printk("\n");
00670 }

00712 
00713 #ifdef __BYTE_ORDER
00714    #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00715    #define __CAVIUM_BYTE_ORDER __CAVIUM_LITTLE_ENDIAN 
00716    #else /* presumably Big Endian :-) */
00717    #define __CAVIUM_BYTE_ORDER __CAVIUM_BIG_ENDIAN 
00718    #endif
00719 #else /* __BYTE_ORDER */
00720 #error __BYTE_ORDER undefined
00721 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER */
00722 
00723 #define CVM_CAST64(v) ((long long)(v))
00724 
00725 #define uint64  unsigned long long
00726 #define uint32  unsigned int
00727 #define uint16  unsigned short
00728 #define uint8   unsigned char
00729 
00730 
00731 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00732 
00733 #endif /* _LINUX_SYSDEP_H */
